clinical_study.brief_title: Oral Health, Bite Force and Dementia
clinical_study.official_title: Oral Health, Bite Force and Dementia - A Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial

brief_summary.textblock: Study aims: The primary aim is to identify influencing variables on oral hygiene / oral health and bite force in patients with dementia.

primary_outcome.measure: Chewing function I (examination with force gauge meter)
primary_outcome.description: Bite Force (Bite Force Meter in Newton)

secondary_outcome.measure: Nutrition I (questionnaire/ assessment of nutritional state)
secondary_outcome.description: Mini Nutritional Assessment (MNA) (Malnutrition present? yes/no/at risk)

secondary_outcome.measure: Nutrition II (examination for weight and body-size)
secondary_outcome.description: Body Mass Index (BMI) (normal weight / under-weight / over-weight)

secondary_outcome.measure: Chewing function II (two-coloured chewing gum to test efficacy)
secondary_outcome.description: Chewing Efficacy (chew two-coloured chewing gum 20 times, visual and optoelectronic evaluation)

arm_group.description: - study population is randomly assigned to control and test group
- study population is randomly assigned to control and test group

intervention.description: test group will receive an dental hygiene program for one year control group will remain with dental hygiene regime like done before study participation (maximum of two dental hygiene Treatments per year)
test group will receive physiotherapy with the aim of increasing muscle strength in chewing muscles for 3 months control group will remain without such training

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- > 59 years
- no acute processes being present
- no known cranio-mandibular dysorder (CMD) or finding of any CMD during study participation
- non or Maximum of one dental hygiene treatment in the last 12 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- younger than 60 years
- acute processes in the oral-facial Region
- known CDM case
- more than one dental hygiene treatment in the last 12 months

facility.name: Clinic of General, Special Care and Geriatric Dentistry
